meanings.definition: Beliefs or opinions contrary to orthodox religious doctrine.
meanings.sent1: The town was divided by the heresies of the new preacher.
meanings.sent2: The council condemned the heresies of the cult leader.
meanings.sent3: The heresies of the dog who believed he was a cat amused the children.
meanings.sent4: Her love for modern art was seen as a heresies in the traditional art community.
meanings.sent5: The heresies of the flat-earth society were quickly debunked by scientists.

meanings.definition: An opinion or belief that contradicts established customs or norms.
meanings.sent1: The artist's unconventional style was considered heresies by the art critics.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, tattoos are seen as heresies.
meanings.sent3: His love for pineapple on pizza was a heresies among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The idea of working remotely was once a heresies but is now widely accepted.
meanings.sent5: The fashion designer's bold choices were seen as heresies in the industry.
